title: Ticket #2953: stringListMember semantics appear incorrect
description:
stringListMember currently evaluates to UNDEFINED if the string list is empty. For example,

stringListMember("foo", "", ",")

is UNDEFINED. I would have expected that this returns FALSE. It causes highly confusing behavior, such as:

stringListMember("foo", "", ",") =?= False

resulting in False.

Jaime tells me this is a change from the old classads.
remarks:
2012-Apr-24 10:44:25 by jfrey:
In old ClassAds, if the list was an empty string, the function would evaluate to false.
check_ins: 2012-Apr-27 11:34   Check-in [31842]: Fix result of ClassAd stringListMember() with empty list. #2953 When ClassAd function stringListMember() is evaluated with an empty list (i.e. the second argument is an empty string), it should evaluate to False, not Undefined. ===VersionHistory:Complete=== (By Jaime Frey )
creator: bbockelm
